ARABIC: إِنَّ ٱلْأَبْرَارَ يَشْرَبُونَ مِن كَأْسٍ كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا كَافُورًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: The truly good will drink from a cup mixed with the coolness of camphor,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Surely the devotees will drink cups flavoured with palm blossoms
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: The virtuous shall drink from a cup tempered with camphor water.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: The virtuous ones will drink from a cup containing camphor
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Indeed the virtuous will drink from a cup, containing a mixture of Kafoor.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, the Abrar (righteous believers) shall drink of a cup mixed with Kafur.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Surely the righteous shall drink of a cup the admixture of which is camphor
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Surely the pious shall drink of a cup whose mixture is camphor,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! the righteous shall drink of a cup whereof the mixture is of Kafur,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: the righteous shall drink from a cup mixed with the coolness of kafur,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily the pious shall drink of a cup whereof the admixture is like Unto camphor.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Indeed the pious will drink from a cup seasoned with Kafur,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: As to the Righteous, they shall drink of a Cup (of Wine) mixed with Kafur,-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily, the Abrar (pious, who fear Allah and avoid evil), shall drink a cup (of wine) mixed with water from a spring in Paradise called Kafur.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: But the righteous shall drink of a goblet mixed with camphor;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: But the righteous will drink from a cup whose mixture is aroma.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed, the righteous will drink from a cup [of wine] whose mixture is of Kafur,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [76:5] Truly the righteous (abrār is the plural of barr or bārr), namely, the obedient ones, will drink from a cup (ka’s is a vessel for drinking wine and this [wine] will be in it; what is meant is [that they will drink] from ‘wine’, [a case where] the actuality is referred to by the name of the locus [in which it is found]; min, ‘from, is partitive) whose mixture, that with which it is mixed, is camphor;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: Lo! the righteous) who are true in their faith and obey Allah (shall drink of a cup) shall drink wine in Paradise (whereof the mixture is of water of Kafur,
